title: Odysseus Sends Back Lunar Images
summary: Intuitive Machines’ Odysseus lunar lander has sent back images days after tipping over while landing near the Moon’s South Pole. The U.S. company was not sure precisely where Odysseus set […]

title: FAA Closes Starship OFT-2 Mishap Investigation
summary: The FAA said today it has closed its mishap investigation of the second orbital flight test of SpaceX’s Starship, OFT-2, that took place last November. SpaceX must implement a set […]

title: SpaceX discloses cause of Starship anomalies as it clears an FAA hurdle
summary: "Several engines began shutting down before one engine failed energetically."

title: FAA closes Starship investigation as SpaceX seeks license for next launch
summary: The Federal Aviation Administration on Monday announced the close of its investigation alongside SpaceX into the second Starship flight, as Elon Musk’s company seeks a license to launch the towering rocket again.

title: Following aborted WDRs Flight 3 enters additional preparations
summary: After two Wet Dress Rehearsal (WDR) aborts, SpaceX opted to destack Ship 28 before removing Booster 10 from the Orbital Launch Mount (OLM). The Booster has since rolled back to the Production Site, while Ship 28 conducted  standalone testing on Pad B, opening with a Spin Prime test on Monday.
